system.description: The standard unit of currency is the silver penny, which is abbreviated as “d”. A penny weighs one dram (a sixteenth of an ounce) and can vary in value from one region to another as a result of its silver content. Copper coins are not minted on Hârn. The silver penny is often divided into two halves (ha'penny) or four quarters (farthings). Gold coins are rare. A gold penny (one dram) would be worth 20d, although gold coins generally come as ounce coins.
